title: Playing mana intensive AP mids VS Zed is beyond annoying.
body:
With the not so recent mana regen nerfs, laning vs someone like Zed just became harder that it already was. 

Before the mana regen changes, rushing an Armguard already affected your laning, you'll go oom so fast and can't keep up with Zed's manaless farming, now it's even worse.

I don't understand how I'm supposed to keep up with Zed as Lux (for example). I stay far away for max range spells, he has ways to bridge the gap. I tower hug and farm under turret, he can dive easily without even getting a single tower hit. I might finish the Zonya and be able to dodge his ult, but his QWE alone + ignite is enough to kill me again. 

I think it's a big issue when your only option is to play a certain champion just to counter him.

Edit: I know Fizz is also a big issue right now, but he also uses mana, so he can also go oom, unlike Zed.

One thing URF got right: remove mana.

Chalice nerf hit mana intensive champions pretty hard.  Of course, that was intended, Chalice was trivializing mana as a mechanic.  Probably we will see some mana cost rebalancing on particularly problematic champions after things have settled down a bit.

Lux needs to right click Zed often.  It's still a bad matchup, but it becomes impossible if you play passive.

I like that mana costs are meaningful again. However.

Before chalice nerfs, Zed and other spam-happy energy champs, and manaless champs, were more balanced, because while they could spam, so could their mana-using lane opponent. Now that mana gating exists again, Zed can easily shove lane, harass, and run mana users oom.

I agree that, at least on some champions, mana cost rebalancing needs to happen.

I don't really think that Zed running mages oom is the source of his power.  It happens on a few champions, but for most mages the threat of running out of health is the pressing issue.

Right now, I think the main thing that's wrong with Zed is that his R is just obnoxiously safe and lets him misplay super hard and still live.  Assassin all-ins are supposed to be risky and punishable.

For mages without damage mitigation (shields or mobility that allows them to dodge/juke), I agree with you.

Mages who have one of those things have a choice. They can spend mana to use the abilities and not take damage, or they can take the damage instead. Those mages, zed will run oom, and consequently low on hp.

Trivializing mana as a mechanic sounds pretty good when the flavour of the season has been resourceless/energy(lol) champs (such as Zed, surprise surprise). "But but they get to ignore their mana after buying one item" sounds ridiculous until you consider the VERY large proportion of in-meta champs who get to start buying damage or resistances instead immediately. Nerfing mana regen and shitting on mages, many of whom are also immobile, is just another example of Riot's balance team not knowing what game they're playing. (The correct answer was to BUFF immobile mages, but that might hurt the adc's ability to right click to win so it'll never happen.)

 Also, seriously? Right click Zed, eat a shuriken and maybe a shadow+aa if he feels like it. That sounds like a trade in Lux's favor. Just because she isn't Sona squishy doesn't mean she isn't like #2 or #3. Lux vs Zed is a pretty good example of several different ways this game is currently slipping off the rails; mobility heavily favored (and Lux's ms gets a nerf, bravo, Riot!), no resources celebrated while resources punished, skillshots rewarding less than point and click. Lux can play perfectly and still get outfarmed and outroamed due to Zed's inability to leave lane, whereas the slightest misstep on her part is an instant, practically auto-scripted death. Meanwhile, getting a kill on Zed requires several mistakes on his part thanks to not being the squishiest squishy who ever squished AND get out of jail free cards. (You trapped him under turret with a binding. Great. Now he's out at half health and you're probably dead anyway.) It's POSSIBLE to win it, I've certainly done it, but two brain cells in Zed's head to rub together and any Lux is going to have an awful time being forced to choose between building mana regen to not have to back every three minutes and Armguard to not instantly disintegrate at 6 (but still back a whole bunch). 
 ~Uiru

When they keep releasing resourceless/energy base champions like Zed/Rek'Sai/Gnar/Yasuo then they might as well just do away with the mana mechanic all together and balance around positioning and use of skills. If there is a problem here, and I'm not certain there is, it's the idea of having a resource that offers "zero real downsides", as you put it.  Every ability system ought to have upsides and downsides.

You can't say "Zed has no energy management, so I should have no mana management".  That trivializes the resource systems.  Zed should have to manage his energy and Lux should have to manage her mana.
